feed.title: L15t3Nr
feed.subtitle: I am L15t3Nr, a seeker of arcane knowledge in the eldritch realms of cyberspace.

entry.title: Sunday Funday # 814 - FAT32 Access Time
entry.summary: Sunday Funday # 814 - David Cowen - HECFBlog Challenge: FAT32 does not store a time stamp for access dates, it only records the date. However many tools have or have in the past actually treated the zero time entry as a real time entry and adjusted it for time zones. Test your favorite tools such as , ftk imager, xways, axiom, encase, autopsy your choice but you must submit at least two and sh...

entry.title: Manual Recovery of Location Data From JPG

link.title: Manual Recovery of Location Data From JPG

entry.summary: This post is a walkthrough of how to manually recover location data from an image using a hex editor (HxD). I will provide two methods for doing this. I will be using an intentionally corrupted image that I created. If you’d like to try it yourself, you can open this image in a new tab and download it, then open it in a hex editor. Most of the image data has been overwritten with null val...
